qas.question: How many units of the Famicom were sold in Japan by the beginning of 1985?
What was this system to be called in North America?
What magazine stated that Nintendo could be errant in their anticipated product success?
How many units of the Famicom were sold in China by the beginning of 1985?
What was this system to be called in South America?
What magazine stated that Nintendo couldn't be errant in their anticipated product success?

context: Subsequent plans to market a Famicom console in North America featuring a keyboard, cassette data recorder, wireless joystick controller and a special BASIC cartridge under the name "Nintendo Advanced Video System" likewise never materialized. By the beginning of 1985, the Famicom had sold more than <a0_0><b3_0>2.5 million<b3_0/> units<a0_0/> in Japan and Nintendo soon announced plans to release it in North America as the <a1_0><b4_0>Advanced Video Entertainment System<b4_0/><a1_0/> (AVS) that same year. The American video game press was skeptical that the console could have any success in the region, with the March 1985 issue of <a2_0><b5_0>Electronic Games magazine<b5_0/><a2_0/> stating that "the videogame market in America has virtually disappeared" and that "this could be a miscalculation on Nintendo's part."
